The water cycle helps
to purify water!

Do this experiment to see how it happens!

Here's what you'll need:

  • 4 cups of dirt or sand

  • A dozen small stones

  • 2 quarts of water

  • A short glass

  • Clear plastic wrap

  • A sunny day

  • A large glass mixing bowl with tall sides

Place the dirt or sand
plus the stones in the bowl.

Add the water and mix.

Place the clean, short glass
in the center of the mixture
in the large bowl. Press the
short glass into the mixture
so that it rests on the
bottom of the bowl.

Place the bowl
outside in the sun.
Be sure that the bowl is
placed on a level surface.

Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and securely wrap it.

Note: If the wrap doesn't stick to the bowl,
use enough so you can cover the bowl
and then weigh down the edges with more stones.

Place one small stone on
the plastic wrap directly over
the short glass. This will allow
the condensation to be captured
by the clean glass. Be sure that
the plastic wrap does not
touch the short glass.

Let bowl stand in
the sun for 4-5 hours.
You will see water droplets start
to form on the plastic wrap.
It's important that you
do not disturb the bowl.

Remove plastic wrap.

Observe!
Your dirt has dried
and your small glass now
has clean water in it!

Your water was purified by
Evaporation and Condensation!
